alternative_parents.description: Benzenoids in which the benzene moiety is N-linked to an hydroxylamine at the 1-position, and unsubstituted at the 4-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxylamino, 4-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Benzenoids in which the benzene moiety is N-linked to an hydroxylamine at the 1-position, and unsubstituted at the 2-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxylamino, 2-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the organic carbonic acid or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Organic carbonic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: N-oxides of imines, with the general structure R1C(R2)=[N+](R3)[O-] (R3 is not an Hydrogen atom).
alternative_parents.name: Nitrones

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of diazene(diimide), HN=NH, wherein both hydrogens are substituted by hydrocarbyl groups, e.g. PhN=NPh azobenzene or diphenyldiazene.
alternative_parents.name: Azo compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds comprising the hydroxylamine functional group, with the general structure R1ON(R2)R3 (R1,R3=H, organyl; R2 = organyl).
alternative_parents.name: N-organohydroxylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Aromatic heterocyclic chemical compounds containing a naphthalene derivative, where two carbon atoms are replaced by nitrogen atoms. They are subdivided in benzodiazines and naphthyridines.
class.name: Diazanaphthalenes

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoxalines. These are compounds containing a quinoxaline moiety, a bicyclic heterocycle made up of a benzene ring fused to a pyrazine ring.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing a quinoxaline moiety, a bicyclic heterocycle made up of a benzene ring fused to a pyrazine ring.
direct_parent.name: Quinoxalines

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a benzene ring fused to a diazine ring. The diazine ring is an analogue of benzene, where two carbon atoms are replaced by nitrogen atoms.
subclass.name: Benzodiazines

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
